intro: Arachnothryx tacanensis, commonly known as the Tacana thryx, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within montane forests. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Arachnothryx tacanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
